properties.description: Posted by ErikI work here right now. We make really good speech recognition software. We\'re on the new BlackBerry Pearl!

properties.name: Arthur D. Healey School
properties.description: Posted by Erik

properties.name: At the office, rue du Faubourg Saint Martin, Paris
properties.description: Posted by Erikparis, france"What? What kind of plane? A small propeller plane, something like that?" Jackie was on the phone with a friend in the US: "No, a big plane." Let\'s see what CNN says. Site... not... there... NYTimes? Dead. Finally Slashdot or something: a big plane. And another one? What?!?! What the fuck is going on?!? Then a blur, pictures, rumors, voices, instant messages, fear, sadness, anger, disbelief and then more disbelief.

properties.name: Bonneville Salt Flats
properties.description: Posted by ErikIn a big book of cars, planes, boats, and trains I had when I was a kid, there was a fascinating entry on the Spirit of America, the car that held the land speed record in 1976. This is that mythical place where those records are broken.

properties.name: Food
properties.description: Posted by ErikThere are some down-market food stores here.

properties.name: Forckenberger Park
properties.description: Posted by ErikSix or seven flavors of awesome. My favorite might be the Abenteuer Kinderspielplatz at the north east end. A playground with a 50-foot high tree house where they play with fire. Yes, real live FIRE. It\'s for kids from 6 to 14. There are a couple of adults -- 23-year-old dreadlocked adults -- on hand to make sure there aren\'t too many deaths. The sign says "This place is dangerous. Don\'t let your kids in if you can\'t handle that."

properties.name: Künstlerhaus Celeste
properties.description: Posted by ErikOne of the many places that have more or less open artists studios that almost anybody can use for very cheap or free. It\'s in a cool old brewery or something. How awesome is that?!

properties.name: Old abattoirs
properties.description: Posted by ErikSlow urban renewal. Townhouses. Lots of vacant lots. A few ruins still.

properties.name: Redbones Art Card Fundraiser
properties.description: Posted by Erik 55 Chester St, Somerville, maMarch 19, 2007 "If you haven\'t been, I highly recommend the fun and obviously family- friendly Art Cards event at Redbones next Monday, March 19th from 4pm on. It\'s a fundraiser for Somerville arts programs for kids and simply fun unto itself."

properties.name: SEZ
properties.description: Posted by ErikOK, it\'s a shame to be starting to add places to the area around the first decent aptartment with one of the saddest stories around here, the Sport- und Erlebnis-Zentrum. This crazy UFO of a structure was home to a bunch of swimming pools, bars, and ice rinks up until 2002, when it shut down for what looks like a pretty open-ended renovation. When the SEZ comes back to life, we will all be very awesomely served by its multitiered awesomeness. As of now, the Bowling Alley is open!

properties.name: Vigo showing Emiko how to climb a tree
properties.description: Posted by Jasonat the top of Mt. TaborFoggy drizzle surrounding the hills. Vigo quickly slipped from this very flexible branch, which whipped Emiko in the face.

properties.name: Volkspark F
properties.description: Posted by ErikAwesome. Skateparks, climbing structure, cool restaurant, fountains, rollerblading track, bunkers, ponds... What more could one want!

properties.name: the first decent apartment
properties.description: Posted by ErikThe realtor used something called bearsmail to send me the "expose" to this place. Can I move the marker? The building is on the other side of Heidnfeldstraße. Quiet street.
